summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) regarding the sharing of OPR's draft report on the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (2006-2008). The email discusses sharing the report with the Epstein team for evaluation regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: OPR Investigation into SD Florida's handling of Epstein case
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) conducted an investigation and produced a draft report regarding how the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein matter during 2006-2008.

events.title: OPR shares draft report with SDNY
events.description: OPR transmits its draft report on the Epstein matter to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, with a copy for review, and the SDNY considers sharing it with their Epstein team regarding the Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) produced a draft report investigating the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006 to 2008.
OPR transmitted this draft report to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York on August 6, 2020.
SDNY prosecutors discussed sharing the OPR report with their 'Epstein team' to evaluate facts and implications for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The correspondence indicates ongoing internal DOJ review of prior prosecutorial decisions related to Epstein during the 2006-2008 period.
